title: Woman, 78, jailed for 22 years for trying to kill her own lawyer with a shotgun
text:
Patricia Currie was 75 at the time of the incident in Louisiana (Picture: St. Tammany Parish Sheriff’s Office)

An American woman, 78, has been convicted of trying to murder her lawyer, who represented her in a bankruptcy case days before.

Patricia Currie was handed a 22-year sentence after bringing a loaded shotgun to Keith Couture’s law office in Covington, Louisiana.

The pensioner, from Mandeville, had arrived with plastic coverings on her feet and hands and a towel draped across her lap in October 2016.

Mr Couture told deputies he had been working alone in the rear area of the office, when he heard the front door open and went to see who had come in.

He found Currie, then 75, seated in the lobby and when he asked what she needed, she pulled out a 410 shotgun from beneath the towel and told him she was there to kill him.

Her lawyer Keith Couture was alone in his office at the time of the incident (Picture: NY Pictures8/Keith Couture)

He found Currie sitting in the lobby with a towel draped over the gun (Picture: NY Pictures8/Keith Couture)

The attorney managed to wrestle the shotgun from Currie and call the police.

But when deputies arrived, Currie was uncooperative, refusing to give her name or work with corrections officers.

Good Samaritan recognized homeless man as old pal and instantly offered him place to live

She testified that she was just trying to scare Mr Couture, who had tried unsuccessfully to withdraw as her attorney in a bankruptcy case a few weeks earlier.

According to court documents seen by the MailOnline, the pair had ‘disagreed fundamentally on the direction and the procedure to take’, but a judge had rejected Mr Couture’s request.

Letters written by Currie were revealed in court, in which she wrote that she understood why people ‘like blowing up buildings and opening fire on anybody and everybody’.

Currie said she understood those who wanted to blow up buildings and open fire on people (Picture: St. Tammany Parish Sheriff’s Office)

She added: ‘That’s the way I feel.’

The New Orlean Advocate reported that the jury deliberated for 15 minutes before finding her guilty in August after a previous attempt to prosecute her had ended in a mistrial.

Prosecutors argued that Currie should receive the maximum sentence of 50 years for her crimes but the Judge settled on a 22-year sentence.

description: Patricia Currie brought a shotgun to a law office in Covington, Louisiana and told attorney Keith Couture that she was here to kill him.
